ch.hevs.isi.core

Class ListenersRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.hevs.isi.core.ListenersRegistry

  • public class ListenersRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores a HashMap of DataPointListeners. It stores a list of connectors to the MinecraftWorld

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ListenersRegistry getInstance()
      This method provides an instance of the list.
      java.lang.Boolean removeMember(DataPointListener dpl)
      This simply removes a connector from the registry (unregister)
      int sizeOfList()
      This method is called when we need to know how many listeners we have in the HashMap
      void subscribe(DataPointListener dpl)
      This adds/register a connector to the Registry
      void updateConnectors(DataPoint dp)
      This method is called to update the datapoint values for each connector of the hashmap

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • updateConnectors

        public void updateConnectors(DataPoint dp)
        This method is called to update the datapoint values for each connector of the hashmap
        Parameters:
        dp - : The datapoint to be updated

      • getInstance

        public static ListenersRegistry getInstance()
        This method provides an instance of the list. This method shall be called within the singleton pattern
        Returns:
        a pointer to the list of listeners

      • sizeOfList

        public int sizeOfList()
        This method is called when we need to know how many listeners we have in the HashMap
        Returns:
        the number of listeners in the list

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(DataPointListener dpl)
        This adds/register a connector to the Registry
        Parameters:
        dpl - a DatapointListeners. The class that calls this method should implement the DataPointListener Interface and implement the OnNewValue() method

      • removeMember

        public java.lang.Boolean removeMember(DataPointListener dpl)
        This simply removes a connector from the registry (unregister)
        Parameters:
        dpl - a DatapointListeners. The class that calls this method should implement the DataPointListener Interface and implement the OnNewValue() method
        Returns:
        a boolean specifying if the DataPointListener was correctly removed from the list True : correctly removed False: not possible to remove (not in the list or not accessible)
